alert.note: Alert for Chinle Valley; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 9:03PM MST until January 07 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 3500 feet near Camp Verde, Chinle, Chino Valley, Congress, Cottonwood, Dilkon, Holbrook, Kayenta, Kykotsmovi, Paulden, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Sedona, Seligman, Snowflake-Taylor, Tuba City and Winslow. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to snow and reduced visibility. * SNOW TABLES...Snow forecast from 2 AM Sunday to 5 PM Sunday: Camp Verde Up to 1 inch Chinle 2 to 4 inches Chino Valley 1 to 3 inches Congress Up to 1 inch Cottonwood Up to 1 inch Dilkon 1 to 3 inches Holbrook Up to 1 inch Kayenta 1 to 3 inches Kykotsmovi 1 to 3 inches Paulden 1 to 3 inches Prescott 3 to 5 inches Prescott Valley 2 to 4 inches Sedona 3 to 5 inches Seligman 2 to 4 inches Snowflake-Taylr 1 to 2 inches Tuba City Up to 1 inch Winslow Up to 1 inch.
info.instruction: If travel is essential, allow for extra drive time and use caution. For the latest road conditions and closures...call the ADOT freeway management system at 1 888 411 7623 or visit their web site at www.az511.com. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
